meanings.definition: Using money and other resources carefully and not wastefully.
meanings.sent1: She is a thrifty shopper, always looking for the best deals.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother is very thrifty and saves every penny she can.
meanings.sent3: The thrifty squirrel saved nuts for the winter, showing its wise spending habits.
meanings.sent4: Her thrifty ways were like a beacon of light in a sea of wastefulness.
meanings.sent5: Being thrifty is like having a superpower that saves you from financial troubles.

meanings.definition: Showing a careful use of money and resources.
meanings.sent1: The thrifty student always packed a lunch to save money.
meanings.sent2: He had a thrifty mindset, always repairing things instead of buying new ones.
meanings.sent3: The thrifty cat carefully counted its treats to make them last longer.
meanings.sent4: Her thrifty habits were a shield against unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent5: The thrifty gardener knew how to make the most of every seed planted.

meanings.definition: Economical in managing money and resources.
meanings.sent1: The thrifty family reused old jars for storing food.
meanings.sent2: Being thrifty meant finding creative ways to save on everyday expenses.
meanings.sent3: The thrifty chef made delicious meals from simple, inexpensive ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her thrifty nature was like a well-oiled machine, always finding ways to cut costs.
meanings.sent5: The thrifty traveler knew how to explore the world on a tight budget.
